title: Fix Celsius to Fahrenheit conversion
message:
Fix Celsius to Fahrenheit conversion

float temperature = 25.0F;
System.out.println((temperature * (9 / 5) + 32)); //Old: 57
System.out.println((((temperature * 9) / 5) + 32));//New: 77

title: The HTTP request to retrieve all weather data within a specified search square…
message: The HTTP request to retrieve all weather data within a specified search square can be made and the information be extracted from the response. These data are sorted as well and the subset to display is extracted. Next step is to show these results to the user.

title: Created the activity for the radius search, integrated it into the menu and…
message: Created the activity for the radius search, integrated it into the menu and created the UI for the activity. Next step is to actually implement the radius search.

title: There is now a heading in the weather details and forecasts activities that…
message: There is now a heading in the weather details and forecasts activities that shows the city and city + date respectively.

title: Updated the headings / labels of some activities.
message: Updated the headings / labels of some activities.

title: Implemented the feature: the weather details view has a bar with the next five…
message: Implemented the feature: the weather details view has a bar with the next five days, when a day is touched the corresponding view is opened which displays the forecast.

title: The weather category (like 'rain' or 'clouds') is now derived from the weather…
message: The weather category (like 'rain' or 'clouds') is now derived from the weather category ID which makes it possible to translate the category. The fields 'Weather category' and 'Weather description' became unnecessary.

title: Fixed app crashes when navigating back and forward.
message: Fixed app crashes when navigating back and forward.

title: For the forecasts there is no value in the OWM response that indicates when the…
message: For the forecasts there is no value in the OWM response that indicates when the data was measured as 'dt' 'dt_txt' both deliver the same value; thus, Forecast.timestamp was defined as the point of time when the record was inserted into the database.

title: Moved all OWM-related Java files into a dedicated package.
message: Moved all OWM-related Java files into a dedicated package.

title: Fixed open issue #1: 'Overview List: Icon not large enough'…
message: Fixed open issue #1: 'Overview List: Icon not large enough' (https://github.com/SecUSo/privacy-friendly-weather-app/issues/1).

title: Feature was implemented!
message: Feature was implemented!

title: When opening the view for the weather details of a city, the forecast data are…
message: When opening the view for the weather details of a city, the forecast data are not retrieved using a background service which is nicer :)

title: When opening the weather details page for a city, the forecast data are retrieve…
message: When opening the weather details page for a city, the forecast data are retrieve and stored in the database.

title: There is now the possibility to make an HTTP query to the OpenWeatherMap server…
message: There is now the possibility to make an HTTP query to the OpenWeatherMap server to request the forecast for a city, parse the response and insert the records into the database.

message: Added the database model for weather forecasts and updated the database configs accordingly.

message: When deleting an item from the overview list, there is now a Snackbar which can be used to restore the deleted entry.

title: Improved the way the city overview list items are displayed: when the text of a…
message: Improved the way the city overview list items are displayed: when the text of a city is too long, multiple lines will be used, at the same time the weather icon appears at the top right corner of the text.

title: When a city is added, it is checked if the city is already in the list of…
message: When a city is added, it is checked if the city is already in the list of watched cities; if so, it will not be added.

message: Added a floating action button to the weather details activity.

message: The actual data are now displayed in the activity.

message: When starting the new activity, a CurrentWeatherData record will be passed on to the new activity.

title: When an item of the RecyclerView is clicked / touched, a new activity is started…
message: When an item of the RecyclerView is clicked / touched, a new activity is started which shows the details. However, this activity has not yet been implemented.

title: Added the functionality to detect onTouch events of RecycleView items.
message: Added the functionality to detect onTouch events of RecycleView items.

title: Two minor improvements on the 'Add location dialog': 1) When a location is…
message: Two minor improvements on the 'Add location dialog': 1) When a location is added, the text of the text field is set to the empty string; 2) the checkbox 'Add permanently' is checked by default.

title: Fixed the two bugs that I mentioned in the last commit; turned out they had the…
message: Fixed the two bugs that I mentioned in the last commit; turned out they had the same origin: While applying the code from the example I used too much of Occam's Razor and deleted the essential onItemMove method from both the interface and the concrete implementation.

title: Feature was implemented: Items can be removed by swiping; 2 issues: 1) lower…
message: Feature was implemented: Items can be removed by swiping; 2 issues: 1) lower items are not pushed above; 2) deletion of >1 items results in a app crash.

title: Forgot to remove unused imports.
message: Forgot to remove unused imports.

title: Added JavaDoc in the FileReader class; changed the way the city records are…
message: Added JavaDoc in the FileReader class; changed the way the city records are inserted into the datatabase even though it does make a performance difference :(

title: Fixed a minor bug: When the database setup was done, the 'Add location' dialog…
message: Fixed a minor bug: When the database setup was done, the 'Add location' dialog was shown even though the floating add location button was not clicked before.

title: Added an app icon; even though it will be changed later it is nicer than the default Android face.
message: Added an app icon; even though it will be changed later it is nicer than the default Android face.

title: On first app start, a background service is started to create the database; if a…
message: On first app start, a background service is started to create the database; if a user clicks the floating add location action button a progress dialog will appear which will be dismissed as soon as the database setup is done.

title: The code for the drop down list of the add dialog was moved to the onTextChanged…
message: The code for the drop down list of the add dialog was moved to the onTextChanged method which improves the user experience (now the dropdown works as expected).

title: When a new city / location is added, it will be displayed on the overview list;…
message: When a new city / location is added, it will be displayed on the overview list; for this some architectural changes hat to be made in order to keep the code clean.

title: When the dialog for adding a new city is opened, the keyboard now shows by default.
message: When the dialog for adding a new city is opened, the keyboard now shows by default.

title: Fixed the issue that the app crashed on re-open.
message: Fixed the issue that the app crashed on re-open.

title: The latitude and longitude information was removed from the city_list.txt file…
message: The latitude and longitude information was removed from the city_list.txt file in order to make it faster so that the initial database setup finishes faster (longitude and latitude are not needed at the moment and if they are at some point they can be queried using the OpenWeatherMap API).

title: The classes, methods and layout files are now available for displaying the city…
message: The classes, methods and layout files are now available for displaying the city overview list; when the app is started, this overview is loaded with the current weather data

title: The file UIUpdater was renamed to DataUpdater and a new UiUpdater was created.…
message: The file UIUpdater was renamed to DataUpdater and a new UiUpdater was created. This way the two functionalities (retrieving data and updating the UI) are separated.

title: 1. Database setup files had to updated because the changes of CurrentWeatherData…
message: 1. Database setup files had to updated because the changes of CurrentWeatherData were no entirely correct but are now; 2. current weather data for multiple locations can be retrieved and written to the database.

title: Added an additional field namely when the data was measured.
message: Added an additional field namely when the data was measured.

title: Added a model for the current weather data of cities / locations and updated the…
message: Added a model for the current weather data of cities / locations and updated the database classes accordingly.

title: The architecture for making HTTP requests to some API was implemented. It is…
message: The architecture for making HTTP requests to some API was implemented. It is flexible and can handle any weather data provider as long as the data are accessible via HTTP.

title: Implemented the methodology for making arbitrary HTTP requests.
message: Implemented the methodology for making arbitrary HTTP requests.

title: Changed the format of the dropdown list to '[city name] ([country])'.
message: Changed the format of the dropdown list to '[city name] ([country])'.

message: The success message template for adding a new location was put into the strings.xml file; when the app is started the table cities_to_watch is cleaned, too (for the reason see program comment).

message: When closing the app all temporary locations are deleted.

title: The use of the AutoCompleteTextView for filtering cities was changed in the way…
message: The use of the AutoCompleteTextView for filtering cities was changed in the way that the Adapter now takes a list of City (before: list of string). This makes it possible to retrieve the selected City object rather than only the city name.

title: Changed 'City of London' to 'London' as querying for cities by name is more…
message: Changed 'City of London' to 'London' as querying for cities by name is more user-friendly when using the patter: LIKE '[city_name]%' (else too many unrelevant results might be returned).
